David Howell

About RSS

Just nuked my Amazon wishlist from orbit, after realizing that it represented a decade of reading. Time to take a deep breath and get more deliberate about this.

📚

22 Jul 2018

I came across @ayjay’s post “in responsibility begin dreams”, which earned a spot on the cork board by my desk.

Everything has been tried and found wanting, and found difficult and left untried. This is the human condition.

21 Jul 2018

Recommended reading for today: Venkatesh Rao’s “The Zeroth Mile” makes the case for becoming “anthropocene literate”, to open our attention to how our lives are grounded in streams of resources and waste.

17 Jul 2018

I consolidated my unread books on one shelf, per Farnam Street. Most of these were acquired by impulse - now it’s time to stew on the whole thing and see if I can retcon a theme. 📚

15 Jul 2018

I started the Farnam Street course “The Art of Reading” yesterday, which so far seems promising. My favorite part is emailing my homework and getting a personal response. 📚

10 Jul 2018

Just learned that micro.blog can mirror your content to a Git repo. I imagine that’s going to be a niche feature, but huge props to @manton for including it. One-off data export is the bar I expect, automated mirroring wins the gold medal.

10 Jul 2018

Maybe mechanical keyboard fans just need to work on their typing skills a little?

08 Jul 2018

For your Sunday, set aside 25 minutes and watch/listen to “Just Ancient Loops”, which is intensely beautiful.

08 Jul 2018

Tell It To Your Robot Bird Friend

My son calls our grill his “robot bird friend”. If I squint, the shelves do resemble wings. Either way, what an awesome phrase.

04 Jul 2018

My Independence Day plans:

Continue reading The Monarchy of Fear, in which Martha Nussbaum examines the damage to our democracy wrought by fear.

Also, a parade, hot dogs, and ice cream.

04 Jul 2018

The WSJ snarked on people who use quantified self to motivate consistent meditation. I wrote up my take on the Beeminder blog:

blog.beeminder.com/meditatio…

30 Jun 2018

I was interviewed for (but not quoted in) a WSJ article about people who strive to maintain daily meditation streaks. I don’t fit the narrative of “nerds missing the point of meditation”, so I’m pleased to have been left out.

13 Jun 2018

I’m feeling torn between micro.blog and Mastodon as a Twitter alternative. This is a nice, sunny place, but Mastodon feels like it might pick up more of the surreal humor culture of Twitter.

Between Slack, Discourse, Micro.blog, and Mastodon, my social networks are fragmenting.

31 May 2018

I initially found tweetstorms irritating as hell, but I’m now 100% on board. The format leads to amazing low-ceremony brain dumps from experts, like Sarah Taber on cattle feed and JIT supply chains:

twitter.com/SarahTabe…

29 May 2018

Thank you for “How to keep going”, Austin Kleon… just what I needed this morning.

24 May 2018

I’m making an Electron app to visualize the network structure of my Evernote corpus. It is not as interesting a graph as I had hoped!

20 May 2018

Today, I dedicate myself to developing the Excellence of screen doors and plant hangers. I beseech you, Hephaestus, to guide my hands.

(h/t Jo Walton and the Thessaly trilogy)

19 May 2018

My favorite part of Instapapering an article from a LinkedIn blog is having the number of recruiter notifications I’m currently ignoring memorialized in the title.

18 May 2018

I love @robinsloan’s take on the game Fortnite & taking a chance on cooperation in a zero-sum space.

Reminds me of Cory Doctorow’s “Weaponized Narrative”: a gesture of cooperation opens a counternarrative to the battle royale.

17 May 2018

I suspect that amateur developers have an easier time of building automation on iOS, in AppleScript, and similar, due to not knowing how comparatively bad the toolchain and development environments are. I love Drafts, for example, but the feedback loop when testing is slow.

16 May 2018
